revised_title: Cholesterol Content in Animal Tissues and its Relation to Diet and Inanition
tldr: This study investigates the cholesterol content in various tissues of rabbits under different diets and during inanition. The results support the hypothesis that cholesterol from broken-down cells is utilized in the formation of new cells, and the liver plays a role in breaking down dead cells and eliminating their cholesterol in bile. The findings also show that the cholesterol content varies in different tissues and is affected by diet and nutritional state.
